Presidente Bernardes is a municipality in the state of São Paulo in Brazil. The town was named after former president Artur Bernardes. The population is 13,023 (2020 est.) in an area of 749 km2. The elevation is 429 m. It is named after former Brazilian president Artur Bernardes.
Media
In telecommunications, the city was served by Telecomunicações de São Paulo. In July 1998, this company was acquired by Telefónica, which adopted the Vivo brand in 2012. The company is currently an operator of cell phones, fixed lines, internet (fiber optics/4G) and television (satellite and cable).

* List of municipalities in São Paulo
